systems.syscore package¶

Submodules¶

systems.syscore.algos module¶

Algos

Basic building blocks of trading rules, like volatility measurement and crossovers

systems.syscore.algos.calc_ewmac_forecast(price, Lfast, Lslow)¶

Calculate the ewmac trading fule forecast, given a price and EWMA speeds Lfast, Lslow and vol_lookback

Assumes that ‘price’ is daily data

systems.syscore.algos.robust_vol_calc(x, days=35, volfloor=True, minquant=0.05, mincount=10, mincountformin=100, daysformin=500, absmin=1e-10)¶

Returns a N day rolling sigma

Optionally: Uses 500 days to calculate sigma floor at 5% point

Optionally (absmin is not None): remove very low values of vol

systems.syscore.dateutils module¶

Various routines to do with dates

systems.syscore.dateutils.expiryDate(expiry_ident)¶

Translates an expiry date which could be “20150305” or “201505” into a datetime

systems.syscore.dateutils.expiry_diff(carry_row, min_days=20)¶

Given a pandas row containing CARRY_CONTRACT and PRICE_CONTRACT, both of which represent dates

Return the annualised difference between the dates

systems.syscore.fileutils module¶

systems.syscore.fileutils.get_pathname_for_package(package_name, path='')¶

Returns the filename of part of a package

eg get_pathname_for_package(“syscore”, “fileutils.py”) will return the location of this files

systems.syscore.genutils module¶

Utilities I can’t put anywhere else...

systems.syscore.genutils.sign(x)¶

Return the sign of x (float or int)

systems.syscore.genutils.str_of_int(x)¶

Returns the string of int of x, handling nan’s or whatever

systems.syscore.objects module¶

Do fun things with objects and classes

systems.syscore.objects.calc_or_cache(some_object, dictname, keyname, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Assumes that some_object has an attribute dictname, and that is a dict

If dictname[keyname] exists return it. Else call func with *args and **kwargs

Used for cache within various kinds of objects like config, price, data, system...

systems.syscore.objects.hasallattr(some_object, attrlist=[])¶

Check something has all the attributes you need

systems.syscore.objects.resolve_data_method(some_object, data_string, _resolved_object=None)¶

eg if data_string=”data1.data2.method” then returns the method some_object.data1.data2.method

systems.syscore.objects.resolve_function(func_or_func_name)¶

if func_or_func_name is a callable function, then return the function

If it is a string containing ‘.’ then it is a function in a module, return the function

systems.syscore.objects.update_recalc(subsystem_object, additional_delete_on_recalc=[], additional_dont_delete=[])¶

Update the recalculation dictionaries when inheriting from a parent

(see system.basesystem and subsystem)

systems.syscore.pdutils module¶

Utilities to help with pandas

systems.syscore.pdutils.apply_cap(pddataframe, capvalue)¶

Applies a cap to the values in a Tx1 pandas dataframe

systems.syscore.pdutils.pd_readcsv(filename)¶

Reads the pandas dataframe from a filename, given the index is correctly labelled
